conclusion: Need to analyze the graph showing displacement as a function of time to determine moments when speed is 5 m/s.
Graph shows a curve where displacement decreases over time, indicating motion in the negative direction.
Slope of the tangent line to the curve gives the instantaneous velocity of the particle.
Velocity is the derivative of displacement with respect to time.
Speed is the magnitude of velocity.
Need to find how many times the magnitude of velocity equals 5 m/s.
Two instances where tangent lines are drawn on the graph.
Each tangent line corresponds to a specific time.
First tangent has a negative slope; if magnitude is 5 m/s, it's one instance.
Second tangent also has a negative slope; if magnitude is 5 m/s, it's another instance.
There are two points where the speed of the particle is 5 m/s.
